messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] international perspectives
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/6/02 7:58:42 PM, jdeets@cfl.rr.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/6/02 7:58:42 PM, jdeets@... writes:

<< Do any of you know of published sources that deal with homeschooling,
ideally unschooling, in places other than the US? I know they exist >>

I don't know that they exist.
Maybe in England.

In Japan, the author of the book will probably be Kyoko, at owj@....
What she has so far is a Japanese translation of Linda Dobson's Homeschooling
Book of Answers.

There are online things in England, but I don't know what there is in the way
of a "real book."

I have some international links at sandradodd.com/unschoolingotherwise

Sandra

messages.subject: international perspectives
messages.msgSnippet: Hello! I thoroughly enjoy listening in on the rich conversations, but have little time to contribute, so thanks for helping me to grow even (especially?) in my
messages.messageBody:
Hello!

I thoroughly enjoy listening in on the rich conversations, but have little time to contribute, so thanks for helping me to grow even (especially?) in my silence.

Tonight, however, I have a question. Do any of you know of published sources that deal with homeschooling, ideally unschooling, in places other than the US? I know they exist, but my university library either doesn't carry or index the sources or I am not using good search terms. Any help you can give me will be greatly appreciated! I am trying to prepare a paper that looks at homeschooling comparatively.

If you'd prefer to reply to me off list, my address is jdeets@....

Cheers,
Jennifer


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
